article_title: Cheaters are smoking, but not paying surcharge on health insurance exchanges
article_text:
Total Access

Enjoy the convenience of home delivery plus Digital D. Sign up for our BEST VALUE today!

article_metadata.description: Barred from restaurants, banned on airplanes and unwelcome in workplaces across America, smokers have become accustomed to hiding their habits. So it’s no surprise many also deny they smoke when buying health coverage from the federal health law’s insurance exchanges. Insurers — who can charge higher rates to admitted smokers in most states — are steamed.
